description: Re-development of existing department store to provide new building of two to seven stories (plus part lower ground floor) for replacement department store with integral coffee shop/restaurant on ground and mezzanine levels (3556sqm); 137 residential units; access, parking, servicing and landscaping (Duplicate Applications)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Details/samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the  development is commenced.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the design is of a high quality commensurate with the site's location and its surroundings, in accordance with adopted policies B1 and B5 and replacement UDP policy 4.1. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of refuse storage and waste management programme, including specification and location of the proposed waste compactor,  for the development hereby permitted in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision as approved shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of each phase of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:  To ensure adequate refuse storage and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies H34, 4.1 and 5.5. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment including details of acoustic measures, and internal gates/fences to be erected.  The boundary treatment including details of acoustic measures and internal gates/fences shall be completed in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently retained.  REASON:  To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies B1, B2 and RUDP policies 4.1 and 4.5. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works (to include semi-mature trees/trees 6m in height) for all external and roof terrace areas, including a phased programme of works for each phase of the development have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of each phase of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with adopted UDP polices B2 and ES4 and Replacement UDP policy 4.5. | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON:  To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies B2, ES4 and RUDP policies 4.5. | The City Car Club shall be established prior to occupation of all the dwellings within the  development hereby approved and shall be operated for a period of at least 10 years unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority.  REASON: In the interest of traffic conditions of the local area, in accordance with adopted and RUDP policies T40 and 9.1 | Prior to occupation of the first dwelling within the development, a Green Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, such Plan approved shall be implemented upon first occupation of any of the dwellings and complied with thereafter. The targets within the Plan shall be subject to monitoring by the Local Planning Authority on an annual basis or timetable as otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To minimise car use and promote alternative modes of travel for residents, staff and visitors to and from the site in accordance with the Council's sustainable development policies and RUDP 9.1. | The cycle parking shown on the approved drawings be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of any of the dwellings, and retained permanently.  REASON:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with Adopted and RUDP policies T15 and 9.6. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of a plan showing the position of the parking bays to be allocated for City Car Club shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of any of the dwellings and thereafter retained for a period of at least 10 years; subject to annual review by the Council.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for City Car Club car parking within the site, in accordance with adopted UDP policy T40 and T56 and Replacement UDP policy 9.1 and 9.8. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plans for each element of the development shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of element of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking, and shall not be used for any other purpose.  .  REASON:  To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with adopted UDP policy T40 and T56 and Replacement UDP policy 9.1. | The areas shown on the approved plans as parking, access, loading, unloading and maneuvering areas for servicing shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only.  REASON:  To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site in accordance with adopted and RUDP policies T43, T44 and 9.11 | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of each phase of development and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of each element of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, ES3 & H12; Replacement Plan policies 4.1, 4.3 & 5.3. | Prior to commencement of works for development, details of acoustic separation between the lower ground floor (basement) car parking area and upper floor residential shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the properties in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | Prior to the commencement of works for the development of the residential accommodation, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, and terraces from external noise and vibration, and sensitive rooms from internal building services noise.  The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified at Document 5.3 "Guidance for developers".  The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria and for windows opening onto Uxbridge Road and Broughton Road to limit exposure to pollution.  The works, as approved, shall be completed before first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the properties in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. (The development will be affected by noise at a level which falls into Categories C and D noise exposure; and elevated levels of traffic related pollution notably nitrogen dioxide.) | No electrical and mechanical plant shall be installed until details of noise assessment relating to the plant have been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented and permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the properties on and adjacent to the site in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of vehicular access including off-site works, new vehicular and pedestrian accesses, traffic control/management system, and programme for implementation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works.  Such details as approved shall be implemented in accordance with the approved programme and thereafter permanently retained.    REASON: In the interests of highway safety, and to protect living conditions of occupiers in the surrounding area and the character and appearance of the surrounding area, in accrdance with Adopted and Replacement UDP policies T62 and 9.1, 9.5. | Notwithstanding details shown on the submitted plans, details of the visibility splays at locations of potential conflict between vehicles and pedestrians shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the development, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the relevant phase, and retained permanently.   REASON: In the interest of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with Adopted and RUDP policies  T62, 9.5 and 9.1 | Development shall not begin until details of drainage works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority; the scheme as approved shall be carried out before any part of the development permitted is occupied.  REASON: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in accordance with Adopted and RUDP policies R10 and 2.5. | Details of the design of the building and car/cycle and parking area, hard and soft landscaping and bin storage areas to comply with the aims and objectives of Secured By Design and Secured Car Parks award shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B20; Replacement Plan policies 4.3 & 4.4. and Supplementary guidance "Safer Ealing". | No deliveries to the retail unit shall take place outside the hours of 7.00 am to 6.00 pm on Mondays to Saturdays, and not at all on Sundays and public holidays.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby residents and occupiers of the new residential units, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B5, ES5; Replacement Plan policy 4.1,4.11. | The hours of operation of the retail unit shall be restricted to 7.00 am to 10.00 pm Mondays to Saturdays and 8.00 am to 5.00 p.m on Sundays.  REASON: In the interests of living conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B5, ES5; Replacement Plan policy 4.1,4.11. | Details, including hours of operation, of all external lighting (including any floodlighting) to be erected, and internal lighting visible from outside the site, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, shall be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The vertical illuminance of any lighting at the nearest affected fatade shall be controlled to a maximum of 10 lux at ground floor level and 5 lux at first floor level and the main beam angle of all lights shall not exceed 70 degrees.  The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the first occupation and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  REASON:   To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with Adopted and Replacement UDP policies B5, ES5, 4.1 and 4.12. | Details of external fume extraction from any cooking, kitchen, and cafT facilities shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on the store development, and such provision as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the retail store and shall thereafter be permanently retained.  REASON:  In the interests of living and working conditions of occupiers on the site and surroundings, and to protect the appearance of the area, in accordance with Adopted UDP and RUDP policies B5, 4.1. | No machinery, plant, openings or ducts shall be installed on any elevations without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with Adopted UDP policies B5 and RUDP policies 4.1. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards or the equivalent RSL standard, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with Adopted UDP and RUDP policies H12, H13, and 5.3. | Residential accommodation shall be constructed to include at least 10% of the units as wheelchair accessible, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure that an adequate proportion of units is wheelchair accessible in accordance with Adopted UDP standards and RUDP policies H12, H13, and 5.3. | Details of a demolition and construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented during the demolition and construction phases.  REASON:  To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies B5, B9, 4.1. | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning(Use Classes) Order, no food sales, other than those associated with the integral A3 coffe shop/restaurant, shall take place from the site. No sub-division of the retail unit hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior written approval of the local planning authority.  REASON: To prevent an over-intensive use of the site in the interests of the amenity of the locality, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies B1, B5 and 4.1. | The A3 use included within the retail store, as shown on the approved drawings, shall be ancillary to      the primary retail use and shall not be operated separately and shall not be enlarged unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  REASON: To restrict the size and character of the A3 use in the interest of the shopping frontage and amenity of surrounding residents within and adjoining the development, in accordance with Adopted  UDP policies and  RUDP policies B5, S1, S16 and 5.5, 7.1 and 7.3. | There shall be no vehicular access from the site through the gate onto Denmark road at any time     unless in an emergency situation.  REASON: In the interest of highway safety and the amenity of the locality, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies B5, T32, T40 and 9.1 | No service vehicles shall be permitted to turn left into the site or right out of the site at the Broughton Road entrance. Details of appropriate traffic signs to restrict this access shall be submitted and approved by the local planning authority and implemented before the development is first occupied and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the recently established `Home Zone` from intrusive commercial traffic so as to maintain the safety and amenity of local residents, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies B5, T32, T40 and 5.5 and 9.1. | Access to all the dwellings from the main entrance off Broughton Road shall be permanently retained.  REASON: In the interests of the safety and security of residents, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies B1, B20 H26 and 4.4 and 5.5.		 | The proposed habitable room windows at the southern end of the western elevation of the development hereby approved shall contain only obscure glass, and shall be permanently fixed shut. A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties - Policies B1, B5, H33, 4.1
